items.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today
items.summary: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

items.title: Elliptic flags Russia-linked crypto platforms‚Äô ongoing sanctions evasion
items.summary: Bitpapa, Garantex and ABCeX were among the cryptocurrency exchanges linked to Russian-tied transactions circumventing Western evasions.

items.title: Revolut confirms ex-employee threatened to leak KYC data for crypto ransom
items.summary: A crypto trader said a former Revolut employee tried to extort him and contacted his relatives. Revolut confirmed an investigation and said no systems were breached.

items.title: Curve founder says DeFi must ditch token emissions for real revenue
items.summary: Curve founder Michael Egorov told Cointelegraph that protocols cannot ‚Äúlive without real revenues flowing‚Äù as token incentives lose power to attract liquidity.

items.title: CoinDesk 20 performance update: AAVE gains 1.7% while index trades lower over weekend
items.summary: Uniswap (UNI) joined Aave (AAVE) as a top performers, gaining 0.5% from Friday.

items.title: Standard Chartered sticks to $2T stablecoin call but trims T-bill impact
items.summary: Standard Chartered slashed its forecast for T-bill demand from stablecoins to $800 billion to $1 trillion by 2028, but maintained its $2 trillion stablecoin market call.

items.title: BitMine Immersion added $98 million of ether last week as losses balloon to more than $8 billion
items.summary: Tom Lee's Ethereum-focused firm continues buying into the crypto market weakness, now 4.42 million ETH tokens, or about 3.66 percent of the total supply.

items.title: Fictional 2028 AI memo imagines mass layoffs and stablecoin adoption
items.summary: Citrini Research‚Äôs 2028 scenario imagines AI turbocharging corporate profits, while hollowing out consumer demand and quietly migrating global payments to stablecoins on cheap chains.

items.title: Austria‚Äôs regulator slaps new business ban on KuCoin‚Äôs EU exchange
items.summary: The Austrian Financial Market Authority has frozen new business at KuCoin EU months after granting the exchange a MiCA license, citing gaps in key AML and sanctions roles.

items.title: Morning Minute: Supreme Court Rules Against Trump Tariffs
items.summary: The decision has led to a roller coaster of crypto price action so far‚Äîbut what does it mean longer term?

items.title: Strategy adds 592 BTC for $40M in 100th Bitcoin purchase
items.summary: Strategy bought 592 Bitcoin for $39.8 million in its 100th purchase, increasing holdings to 717,722 BTC.

items.title: U.S. Treasury may boost T-Bill issuance as stablecoins eye $2 trillion market cap: StanChart
items.summary: The bank said stablecoins may generate up to $1 trillion in fresh Treasury bill demand by 2028, allowing the government to ramp up issuance and suspend 30-year bond auctions.

items.title: Pantera leads $11.5M round in Based, a Hyperliquid-powered crypto app
items.summary: The company said the fresh capital will be used to expand into new markets and build out its onchain financial infrastructure.

items.title: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas remains bullish on bitcoin after plunge
items.summary: Salinas has previously said he has 70% of his liquid assets in bitcoin.

items.title: How SocialFi, memecoins and AI pushed Base to the top of the L2 ladder
items.summary: Base rode SocialFi, memecoins and AI agents to the top of Ethereum‚Äôs layer-2 ladder before turning inward to rebuild its core stack.

items.title: Strategy logs 100th bitcoin purchase announcement, adding 592 coins last week for $39.8 million
items.summary: Led by Executive Chairman Michael Saylor, the company now holds 717,722 bitcoin, purchased at an average price of $76,020 per coin, for a total of $54.56 billion.

items.title: Stablecoins Set to Scoop Up $1T in T-Bills by 2028: Standard Chartered
items.summary: Standard Chartered sees $0.9T excess demand for U.S. Treasury bills, raising odds of reduced 30-year bond auctions.

items.title: Bitmine paper loss nears $8.8B as Ether slump tests cyclical thesis
items.summary: The mounting unrealized losses of Bitmine shareholders and Ether‚Äôs 60% decline are signaling a critical inflection point that may define Ether‚Äôs medium-term momentum, analysts said.

items.summary: Your day-ahead look for Feb. 23, 2026

items.title: Crypto funds lose $288M as ETPs extend outflow run to five weeks
items.summary: Crypto investment products posted outflows for a fifth straight week, marking the longest exit streak since the launch of spot Bitcoin ETFs in 2024.

items.title: Bitcoin treasuries log rare selling streak as BTC trades near $66K
items.summary: Continued selling from treasury companies and US Bitcoin ETFs threatens a deeper retracement for BTC, but some analysts see it as a sign of a healthy flush in speculative leverage.

items.title: Bitcoin stabilizes after overnight crypto rout, bouncing to $66,000
items.summary: Bitcoin fell to $64,270 shortly after midnight UTC before rebounding to $66,300, as thin liquidity amplified moves tied to U.S. tariff plans and geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Australian Police Charge Man Over $3.5M Crypto Investment Scam Targeting Elderly Victims
items.summary: Australian police linked the NEXOpayment portal to the alleged laundering of funds from 190 elderly investors.

items.title: Pre-market trading stabilizes as bitcoin reclaims $66,000, Saylor eyes 100th BTC purchase
items.summary: President Trump‚Äôs proposed tariffs and U.S. tensions with Iran have weighed on broader risk sentiment.

items.title: Bank of Korea renews call for bank-led won stablecoins as bill stalls
items.summary: The Bank of Korea proposed a bank-led consortium and a statutory interagency body for issuer approvals, citing the US GENIUS Act as a model, according to local media.

items.title: KuCoin told to halt new EU business due to compliance staffing shortfalls
items.summary: Austria's financial regulator said KuCoin EU must appoint an anti-money-laundering officer and deputy officer, as well as a sanctions compliance officer and deputy.

items.title: Bitcoin balances on Binance hit highest since November 2024: here's what it means
items.summary: Users' bitcoin holdings in wallets linked to Binance have climbed to highest since late 2024.

items.title: Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin accelerates ether sales
items.summary: The latest sales are part of a broader plan announced in late January to fund ecosystem development and other initiative.

items.title: Bitdeer sold all its bitcoin to fund its move into AI data centers
items.summary: Singapore based BTC and AI miner sells all holdings to build liquidity for expansion, signaling a broader shift in capital strategy across the sector.

items.title: Bitcoin's Dip Under $65K Pushes Crypto Liquidations to $500M
items.summary: Bitcoin's drop below $65K triggered over $500M in liquidations, as macro uncertainty from tariffs and geopolitics reprices risk assets.

items.title: Tyler Winklevoss upbeat despite brutal sentiment as Gemini troubles deepen
